title: Mixed Micellar Gel of Poloxamer Mixture for Improved Solubilization of Poorly Water-Soluble Ibuprofen and Use as Thermosensitive In Situ Gel.

evidence.snippet: ...The release of ibuprofen from the thermosensitive mixed micellar depots was sustained through a diffusion-controlled mechanism.
...the in vitro release of ibuprofen from the mixed micellar gels was assessed.
...the binary mixture with the P403:P407 molar ratio of 0.75:0.25...cumulative release was measured at 12 hours, giving a value of 5.04 mg/cm².

records.notes: The endpoint Jss was not explicitly reported. Q_final value was obtained from the text describing cumulative release at the last time point.

title: Fluorinated PAMAM-Arginine Carrier Prodrugs for pH-Sensitive Sustained Ibuprofen Delivery

evidence.snippet: Franz diffusion cell was used in the study.
This study focuses on IVPT with ibuprofen formulations.
The Q_final for the release at the last time point evaluated was 130 mg at 130 hours.
The ibuprofen was tested at a concentration of 10 mg/mL.

records.notes: All values are explicitly reported; endpoints are actual numeric values.

title: Controlled Release of Multiple Therapeutics from Silicone Hydrogel Contact Lenses

evidence.snippet: The cocktail of molecules for the combination release devices were 120 kDa HPMC, trehalose, prednisolone, and ibuprofen.
Without imprinting mechanisms, the release of both of these molecules was complete in approximately half a day.

records.notes: The main endpoint Q_final was not reported numerically in the text; set to null. The full text may contain supplementary information.

extraction_notes: Only one formulation of ibuprofen was detailed in the text. The cumulative amount released or permeated (Q_final) could not be explicitly determined from the provided text.

title: Vapour-phase method in the synthesis of polymer-ibuprofen sodium-silica gel composites.

evidence.snippet: the release proﬁles of ibuprofen sodium from composites demonstrate that there are differences in the rate and efﬁciency of drug desorption from them.
the drug contents in ternary composites, taking into accounts the mass of the total carrier system, were estimated to be 39 mg/g for HP-DA

records.notes: The main endpoint is not available in numeric form; it's discussed qualitatively.

extraction_notes: Only one record extracted, as no distinct additional formulations were explicitly listed.

title: Regulating the Skin Permeation Rate of Escitalopram by Ion-pair Formation with Organic Acids.
extraction_notes: Only one formulation (ESP-IB) clearly defined. Endpoints directly provided as numeric values.

title: Decellularized Macroalgae as Complex Hydrophilic Structures for Skin Tissue Engineering and Drug Delivery

evidence.snippet: For the preparation of skin tissue engineering hydrogels, cellulose is mainly used after several chemical modifications.
This study highlights some original data, and others very few or not yet reported.
The release profiles for the decellularized macroalgae hydrogels indicated a steady, controlled release of ibuprofen over 4–6 h.

records.notes: Main endpoint not explicitly stated in numeric form; requires further details from figures.
